text: Claude Durand in 2011 Claude Durand (1938-2015) was a French publisher, translator and writer. He worked in the French film industry editing films, and occasionally writing and directing. He published leading authors such as Solzhenitsyn and Houellebecq, and together with his wife Carmen, he translated the standard French edition of Gabriel Garcia Marquez's novel One Hundred Years of Solitude. As a writer, he won the 1979 Prix Medicis for his novel La Nuit zoologique.Obit == Publications == * Agent de Soljenitsyne (Fayard, Paris 2011). ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2015 deaths Category:French writers Category:People from Paris
